snippet: After the death of Philando Castile and sniper fire in Dallas were streamed on Facebook, the company faces questions about how to handle graphic content....
abstract: Facebook grapples with questions raised by its live-video application following real-time streaming of shooting of Philandro Castile by police in Minnesota and ambush of officers in Dallas; evolution of social media platform into news source is forcing company to realize it needs content guidelines.

byline.original: By MIKE ISAAC and SYDNEY EMBER
byline.contributor: Mike Isaac reported from San Francisco, and Sydney Ember from New York.

lead_paragraph: After the death of Philando Castile and sniper fire in Dallas were streamed on Facebook, the company faces questions about how to handle graphic content.

headline.main: Live Footage of Shootings Forces Facebook to Confront New Role
headline.print_headline: Facebook Live Videos  Pose Tangle of Questions

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dallas, Tex, Shooting of Police Officers (2016)
